Yes, though it ends up being slightly longer:
serializer = LastUpdatedSerializer(data=request.data)
serializer.is_valid(raise_exception=True)
request_ts = serializer.validated_data['last_updated']

The call to is_valid is required, without it, accessing validated_data throws an error (I wish it would just run the validation, instead of raising an error). This is probably more readable though, what do you think?
